objdescid.origination: William Blake author, inventor, delineator, etcher, printer, colorist

objinfo.objsize: ranging between 23.8 x 17.4 cm. and 23.1 x 16.3 cm. In Copies C-I, K, L, and R, the word "Preludium" (not "PRELUDIUM," pace Bentley page 91 and Erdman page 802) is printed from a small, separate copperplate, Bentley Plate e, 2.4 x 8.0 cm. In Copies A, B, and O, the word "Preludium" is omitted. In Copy M, "PRELUDIUM" (all capitals) is written by hand. Object 11 is in the second of two states, with additional white line work in the lower left margin and just above the bottom edge of the plate. The first state is found only in Copy L. Object 13 is in the second state, with a single tail on the snake, lower left.
objinfo.medium: Relief etching, with hand coloring and extensive white-line etching on Plates 1, 8, 10, 11, and 15. Most other plates bear at least touches of white-line etching/engraving.
objinfo.watermark: 1794/J Whatman The watermark appears only on Plates 4, 12, 16, and 17.

provenance.name: Morgan Library and Museum
provenance.price: Probably about £260, the price at which the dealer Bernard Quaritch advertised this copy in 1909.
provenance.note: Acquired from Blake by George Romney, probably in about 1795, and sold posthumously for Romney's son John, Christie's, 9 May 1834, lot 83, with Copy B of *The Book of Urizen* (£1.4s. to the dealer R. H. Evans); probably Isaac D'Israeli; sold anonymously, Hodgson auction, 14 Jan. 1904, lot 222 (Â£207 to the dealer Bernard Quaritch); offered in Quaritch's June 1904 catalogue 231, item 1602, for £260, and at the same price in Quaritch's March 1909 catalogue 273, item 287, and in his 1909-10 *Catalogue of Works on the Fine Arts*, item 287; sold by Quaritch to the Pierpont Morgan Library on 6 May 1909.

repository.department: Department of Printed Books and Bindings
